Key Match Events: Suryakumar Yadav's half-century and Arshdeep Singh's 4-wicket spell saved India's first game against United States
India defeated United States by 7 wickets
Pre-Game Insights: Indian captain Rohit Sharma won the crucial toss at the New York stadium and chose to bowl first
The outfield is slow. Some shots get a lot of bounce on the field, and some others do not roll on the field. So running between the wickets is important.

Rohit Sharma on New York's pitch: 'The problem with Virat Kohli is that there has been a lot of talk about his strike rate over the last two years, and he completely changed that during this IPL season. His strike rate had reached 150, although others had almost 200, but that is a different topic. He probably must have come to the T20 World Cup with that same mindset, but given the pitches, the old Virat Kohli would have been much better.'

USA captain Aaron Jones said: 'We are going to come hard at India. We want to play every game hard, play fearless cricket and come out on top. We have been training hard and playing good as a team over last couple of weeks. We are looking to do the same tomorrow'

Sanjay Manjrekar: 'The problem with Virat Kohli is that there has been a lot of talk about his strike rate over the last two years, and he completely changed that during this IPL season. His strike rate had reached 150, although others had almost 200, but that is a different topic. He probably must have come to the T20 World Cup with that same mindset, but given the pitches, the old Virat Kohli would have been much better'
Post-Match Reflections: Suryakumar Yadav's stunning half-century lead IND to T20 World Cup 2024 Super 8 stage
Arshdeep Singh and Hardik Pandya delivered a beautiful spell to clinch multiple wickets
India is currently at the top of the group with two wins in two games and four points
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rain delays led to the game being postponed until the next day
India vs USA match starts at 8 PM (India time)
United States' Saurabh Nethralvakar celebrated the dismissal of India's Virat Kohli
India and the United States of America will meet on June 12 at the Nassau County International Cricket Stadium in New York. This will be their first-ever encounter in any form of cricket.
